definition[0]: a university degree in the skills needed to be in charge of a business that you can get after your first degree. A person who has this degree is also called an MBA
example[0]: Rick is a 32-year-old MBA from Harvard.
definition[1]: Master of Business Administration; a university degree that teaches you the skills you need to manage a business or part of a business
example[1]: Smith received an MBA from the Harvard Business School.
